metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5546 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The freelist-randomization feature in mm/slab.c in the Linux kernel 4.8.xand 4.9.x before 4.9.5 allows local users to cause a denial of service(duplicate freelist entries and system crash) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact in opportunistic circumstances by leveraging the selection ofa large value for a random number.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-lowlatency - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
